name: indecorously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
badly or rudely: The audience behaved indecorously, as if the concert were an informal rehearsal. He rather indecorously told us the secret she had been trying to keep from us. See
indecorous
More examplesFewer examplesAfter several losing seasons, the team manager was indecorously told to leave.They spent the week behaving indecorously and staying up too late. The noisy students were finally quite indecorously thrown out.
